column1: Isn't it clearly fair to call the Vietnam War a blatant war of American aggression?
Wasn't Nikita Khrushchev plainly justified in placing missiles in Cuba in 1962 to deter another US invasion after the Bay of Pigs?
Wasn't the US invasion of Iraq manifestly unjustified given the thoroughly discredited WMD intelligence?
Wasn't the atomic bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki a needless and disproportionate decision rather than a necessity to end WWII?
Wasn't the 1983 US invasion of Grenada an unjustified overreach that blatantly violated international law?
Isn't it accurate to call the 1989 invasion of Panama a flagrant act of US aggression?
Wasn't the 1945 USAAF bombing of Dresden morally indefensible given its limited military-industrial capacity?
